thread.title: Key iPhone tech gets Apple into deep legal troubles: Company risks up to $862.4M in damages
thread.title_full: Key iPhone tech gets Apple into deep legal troubles: Company risks up to $862.4M in damages - newsR

author: newsr.in
title: Key iPhone tech gets Apple into deep legal troubles: Company risks up to $862.4M in damages
text: Apple’s iPhones have consistently been able to outperform rivals from the competition without necessarily matching their hardware. The primary “culprit” is Apple’s custom AX chip design that’s miles ahead of the competition. However, the same chips got Apple in legal troubles, as the company has apparently been using energy-efficiency technology in A7 and A8 processor that was patented way back in 1998 by the University of Wisconsin Alumni Research Foundation. WARF sued Apple in early 2014, with a jury finding that Apple has infringed the technology described in the patent. The iPhone maker now faces damages of up to $862.4 millions, though they’re yet to be determined. DON’T MISS: iPhone 6s Plus vs. Galaxy Note 5: Real world performance test »
